Most people don't have UTW and it gives the false impression, that there aren't importers for other tagging systems.

item.title: Ticket #5057 (cannot remove all categories from a post) updated
item.dc:creator: foolswisdom
item.description:
Milestone changed

My hazy brain also seems to recall that this is done on purpose. I think somewhere there may be an assumption that a post has 1+ categories.

Replying to Denis-de-Bernardy:

This might arguably be on purpose, but if so it's a bit odd in that in the last version of WP a post could have no categories.

That's not true. I confirmed the same behavior is in 2.2.3 and 2.1.3 .

item.dc:creator: foolswisdom
item.description: Convert All Should Go

item.dc:creator: foolswisdom
item.description: Maybe a stronger warning would help?

item.title: Ticket #5058 ("Convert All Categories" likely should be removed) created
item.dc:creator: foolswisdom
item.description:
"Convert All Categories" likely should be removed

Early feedback shows at least one person "Convert All Categories" making all of their categories disappear. ​http://comox.textdrive.com/pipermail/wp-testers/2007-September/005227.html

I don't understand the scenario where this button would often be used. I think maybe it would make a better plugin or something.

item.title: Ticket #5057 (cannot remove all categories from a post) updated
item.dc:creator: ryan
item.description: Actually, maybe it is on purpose. At least it seems to have behaved like this for awhile. wp_update_post() looks like is discards empty post_category arrays.

item.title: Ticket #5057 (cannot remove all categories from a post) updated
item.dc:creator: ryan
item.description: Not an purpose. Definitely a bug.

item.title: Ticket #5057 (cannot remove all categories from a post) created
item.dc:creator: Denis-de-Bernardy
item.description:
When a post has any number of categories, you cannot deselect them all. If you do so, WP ignores the category update altogether and sticks with the old set of categories.

This might arguably be on purpose, but if so it's a bit odd in that in the last version of WP a post could have no categories.

item.title: Ticket #5056 (adding a new link redirects user to the dashboard) created
item.dc:creator: Denis-de-Bernardy
item.description: when I create a link, I'm consistently redirected to the Dashboard rather than to the Add Link screen.

item.title: Ticket #5055 (upgrader problem with category links) created
item.dc:creator: Denis-de-Bernardy
item.description:
I had no links on my test blog, so the link2cats table was presumably empty. Yet WP 2.3 RC1 created 7 items related to the link_category taxonomy when upgrading the site from WP 2.2.3.

It might just be my own site that had corrupt data, but it's still worth doing a quick check imho.

item.dc:creator: nbachiyski
item.description: westi, we aren't always generating the permalink based on information we have in the database. Usually the title is used, but users are allowed to enter their own slugs and we don't keep the original slug -- only the sanitized one.

item.dc:creator: Viper007Bond
item.description:
worksforme:

Unable to reproduce using the default theme.

item.title: Ticket #5052 (wp_list_bookmarks() generates the same ID for each link category) created
item.dc:creator: znuff
item.description:
Using wp_list_bookmarks() generates the same id="links" for all link categories one person could have.

According to the HTML specs, id should be unique. Thus every theme that uses wp_get_bookmarks() will fail validation.

item.title: Ticket #5048 (Update jQuery form plugin) updated
item.dc:creator: filosofo
item.description:
Replying to Viper007Bond:

No, it's waiting for 2.4. There were some compatibility issues to be dealt with if I remember correctly. Look around -- there's a few tickets on it already.

I think you're thinking of the interface jQuery plugin, not the form plugin. Unlike interface, form is not currently being used in trunk WP, so there could not be any compatibility problems.

item.title: Ticket #5051 (Pages' names containing & don't get escaped) created
item.dc:creator: znuff
item.description: If you create a page with the title containing a &, like q&a, the & sign won't be escaped in the generated html code (&) in the $page_title variable, thus failing html validation.

item.dc:creator: Viper007Bond

worksforme:

Works fine for me using FF 2.0.0.7. 

<input type="text" name="post_title" size="30" tabindex="1" value="" id="title" />

<textarea class='mceEditor' rows='25' cols='40' name='content' tabindex='2' id='content'></textarea>

Note the tabindex'es.

item.title: Ticket #5015 (Add_Filter priority fails with some hooks) updated
item.dc:creator: markjaquith
item.description: Ah, that's because wpautop() (which turns line breaks into paragraphs) is a filter on the_content with a priority of 10. So before that (1-9), you're dealing with line breaks. After that (11 and up), you'll have paragraph tags.

item.title: Ticket #5050 (the_category and get_the_category_list should accept post ID as an argument) created
item.dc:creator: filosofo
item.description:
There are a number of times when it would be nice to get the categories for a post outside of the loop.

My patch allows one to specify the post id, with no back-compat issues, as get_the_category_list calls get_the_category, which already can accept post ID as an argument.

item.description:
Keywords changed

I guess we need to make sure that any changes we make to the slug generation code they don't affect old posts in the way it currently does.

We should always be checking against the string we use to generate the permalink not a re-santized one.

item.title: Ticket #5048 (Update jQuery form plugin) created
item.dc:creator: filosofo
item.description:
The script-loader registers the jQuery form plugin with the wrong version. This might create a problem if someone checks against the plugin version, as it's an old version.

Speaking of which, could we please, please include the newest version of the jQuery form plugin, which I've attached, in 2.3? Although the script-loader registers the form plugin, trunk WP does not enqueue it anywhere yet, so updating to the newest version of the form plugin should have no effect on core WP.

item.title: Ticket #5015 (Add_Filter priority fails with some hooks) updated
item.dc:creator: mattyrob
item.description:
You are quite right - no bug in the add_filter code. Still something funny going on though.

Basically I've fixed my issue so I'll leave this ticket closed but..

I have a preg_replace looking for (<p>)(\n)*<!--subscribe2-->(\n)*(</p>) which worked fine with no priority set and with the priority set as 10. Lower than this it fails unless I change my regualr expression to <!--subscribe2-->.

item.title: Ticket #5047 (dbDelta generates E_WARNING if no indices are defined) updated
item.dc:creator: arnee
item.description: Keywords, Status changed

item.title: dbDelta.diff attached to Ticket #5047
item.dc:creator: arnee
item.description: if(is_array($indices)) Diff

item.title: Ticket #5047 (dbDelta generates E_WARNING if no indices are defined) created
item.dc:creator: arnee
item.description:
dbDelta tries to loop through the array of indexes with foreach, but this array is NULL if no indexes are defined. Foreach with NULL => E_WARNING

Solution: Check if $indices is an array

item.title: Ticket #4981 (the_tags functions : add a param for no tags) updated
item.dc:creator: momo360modena
item.description: Severity changed

item.title: Ticket #5046 (Statistics API for the Plugin Directory) created
item.dc:creator: johnbillion
item.description:
Are there any plans for an API for plugin download statistics on the ​Plugin Directory?

Wouldn't it be great to be able to display the total number of downloads for your plugin on your blog, just like on your plugin's statistics page on wordpress.org/extend.

A simple XML file is all that would be needed. I see there's already an XML file[1] for recent download activity (which is used to build the graph on the stats page) but none for total downloads etc.

How about it?

[1] Example: ​http://wordpress.org/extend/stats/plugin-xml.php?slug=podpress

item.title: Ticket #5044 (WordPress database error) created
item.dc:creator: mann3r
item.description:
when moderating comment, it always go to this WordPress database error: [Table 'mydatabase.wp_post2cat' doesn't exist] SELECT cat_ID AS ID, MAX(post_modified) AS last_mod FROM wp_posts p LEFT JOIN wp_post2cat pc ON p.ID = pc.post_id LEFT JOIN wp_categories c ON pc.category_id = c.cat_ID WHERE post_status = 'publish' GROUP BY cat_ID

WordPress database error: [Table 'mydatabase.wp_post2cat' doesn't exist] SELECT cat_ID AS ID, MAX(post_modified) AS last_mod FROM wp_posts p LEFT JOIN wp_post2cat pc ON p.ID = pc.post_id LEFT JOIN wp_categories c ON pc.category_id = c.cat_ID WHERE post_status = 'publish' GROUP BY cat_ID

WordPress database error: [Table 'mydatabase.wp_post2cat' doesn't exist] SELECT cat_ID AS ID, MAX(post_modified) AS last_mod FROM wp_posts p LEFT JOIN wp_post2cat pc ON p.ID = pc.post_id LEFT JOIN wp_categories c ON pc.category_id = c.cat_ID WHERE post_status = 'publish' GROUP BY cat_ID

WordPress database error: [Table 'mydatabase.wp_post2cat' doesn't exist] SELECT cat_ID AS ID, MAX(post_modified) AS last_mod FROM wp_posts p LEFT JOIN wp_post2cat pc ON p.ID = pc.post_id LEFT JOIN wp_categories c ON pc.category_id = c.cat_ID WHERE post_status = 'publish' GROUP BY cat_ID

WordPress database error: [Table 'mydatabase.wp_post2cat' doesn't exist] SELECT cat_ID AS ID, MAX(post_modified) AS last_mod FROM wp_posts p LEFT JOIN wp_post2cat pc ON p.ID = pc.post_id LEFT JOIN wp_categories c ON pc.category_id = c.cat_ID WHERE post_status = 'publish' GROUP BY cat_ID

but trying to refresh the browser yield to a success with no error.

item.title: Ticket #5033 (Better error_reporting and a debug mode) updated
item.dc:creator: darkdragon
item.description:
It is not my intention to be rude, the code would functionality be the same as it is now but allow those who want to see all errors to see them. However, I think that it should be instead assumed that if there is no WPDEBUG constant in wp-config.php, that the server is production.

In this way, I don't have to keep replacing the E_ALL with "0" each time I upgrade.

item.title: Changeset in tests [16]: move _make_user() to base.php

item.description: move _make_user() to base.php

item.title: Ticket #5042 (incoming links display posts on the blog itself) created
item.dc:creator: kingjacob
item.description: The incoming links in the dashboard ,which now uses google blogs and not technorati, displays posts made on the blog and not just incoming links.

item.title: Ticket #5034 (Impossible to have duplicate category slugs with different parents) updated
item.dc:creator: snakefoot
item.description: Btw. WP already makes new slugs when upgrading (avoids duplicate slugs by appending a counter), but not very elegant though will probably be acceptable for most.

item.title: database problem.jpeg attached to Ticket #5041
item.dc:creator: liciece

item.title: Ticket #5041 (WordPress 2.3 RC1 issue) created
item.dc:creator: liciece
item.description: Once I upgraded to 2.3 RC1,when I post a entry or comment,they will show lack of some database info. You can see the snapshot with my latest blog entry-http://www.liciece.com/?p=196 Thank you.

item.title: Ticket #5034 (Impossible to have duplicate category slugs with different parents) updated
item.dc:creator: snakefoot
item.description:
Guess one should be able to change the inner workings of the API, so terms are identified using the taxonomy-id instead. Post-categories, link-categories and tags would use taxonomy-id as their id.

This wouldn't break API's (one can always get a unique term using the taxonomy-id). Though it would change id's for all taxonomy-types (like ids changes with WP 2.3), and plugins will require a new API to aquire the actual term-id.

But it will pretty much require a complete rewrite of all taxonomy code :)

Guess I'm stuck with WP 2.0

item.title: Ticket #5033 (Better error_reporting and a debug mode) updated
item.dc:creator: foolswisdom
item.description: Keywords changed

item.title: Ticket #5033 (Better error_reporting and a debug mode) updated
item.dc:creator: foolswisdom
item.description: Milestone changed

item.title: Ticket #5040 ([5263] Causes Safari to open WP export in feed reader) created
item.dc:creator: markjaquith
item.description: Safari opens WP exports in a feed reader, instead of downloading it. mdawaffe says [5263] is the culprit.

item.title: Ticket #5034 (Impossible to have duplicate category slugs with different parents) updated
item.dc:creator: ryan
item.description: In retrospect, we probably should have gone with passing term_taxonomy_id instead of term_id + taxonomy around the API and adding parent to the term_taxonomy keying. But, term_id + taxonomy is what we have. I think we'll have to make new term_ids with unique slugs to work around this.

item.title: Changeset [6151]: Core and plugin update checking: make sure fsockopen() is available ...
item.dc:creator: markjaquith
item.description: Core and plugin update checking: make sure fsockopen() is available and check file resources with is_resource() -- both to prevent feof() infinite loops. Props xknown. fixes #5037

item.title: Ticket #5037 (WordPress 2.3 doesn't finish to load when fsockopen has been disabled) closed
item.dc:creator: markjaquith
item.description:
fixed:

(In [6151]) Core and plugin update checking: make sure fsockopen() is available and check file resources with is_resource() -- both to prevent feof() infinite loops. Props xknown. fixes #5037

item.title: Ticket #5033 (Better error_reporting and a debug mode) updated

+1, but i think this should be consider in the 2.3 release
